reqs: Pre-reqs: MECH 328. (and fourth-year standing in the Biomedical Option.)
description: A capstone design program designed to give students experience in the design and development of practical biomedical devices. Projects are provided by local industry and engineering research laboratories. For students in the Biomedical Option only. Credit will be granted for only one of MECH 454, MECH 457, MECH 458, MECH 459, or APSC 496.
